wikipedia_page.main: John Halford (21 April 1846 at Redmarley D'Abitot, Worcestershire – 1 April 1901 at Gloucester) was an English cricketer who played first-class cricket from 1870 to 1874 for Gloucestershire.  He was a right-handed batsman (RHB) and wicket-keeper who made 10 career appearances. Halford scored 150 runs with a highest score of 42.  He held 8 catches and completed 1 stumping.
